text:
Customers often have multiple applications consuming
information from a single set of data in Amazon S3

but each requiring different variations of the data to
meet their specific needs.

One application might operate on CSVs, while another
uses JSON. Another may need to read some sensitive

data, while the others should have portions of that data
redacted. Traditionally, to provide multiple applications

with the right data, you’d have to either transform
the requested data in real time by using a proxy

in front of S3, which you’d then need to manage, or
you’d have to create and store additional derivative

copies of the data so that each application has its own
custom-built dataset.

In both cases, you’d be responsible for building and
operating custom data processing software on

additional infrastructure and storage, which adds
complexity and cost.

Now, with Amazon S3 Object Lambda you can
automatically invoke any AWS Lambda function

when retrieving objects from S3, enabling you to
process and deliver customized objects to

different applications. You can mask sensitive
data for security and compliance, compress

objects, change data formats to ensure
application compatibility, filter data to

deliver specific information, or customize data however
else your specific use case demands.

S3 Object Lambda makes it easy to process and
transform data, without having to build and operate

additional software and infrastructure or create
derivative copies of your data, and it has all of the

features and capabilities of AWS Lambda. You
can start using S3 Object Lambda functions with

just a few steps in the S3 management console.
S3 will automatically invoke your specified

Lambda function during an S3 GET request and
stream the processed data from the function back

to your application. To learn more about Amazon S3 Object
Lambda, please visit the feature page linked below.
